MagneticSolutionAxiStatic

class pyrit.solution.MagneticSolutionAxiStatic(description: str, vector_potential: ndarray, axi_mesh: mesh.AxiMesh, tri_axi_edge_shape_function: shapefunction.TriAxisymmetricEdgeShapeFunction, regions: Regions, materials: Materials, excitations: Excitations)

Bases: StaticSolution, MagneticSolutionAxiBase

Solution of a static, two-dimensional magnetic problem in axisymmetric coordinates.

The corresponding problem class is MagneticProblemAxiStatic.

A general, static solution.

Parameters

  • description (str) – A description of the solution.

  • solution (np.ndarray) – The solution.

  • mesh (Mesh) – A mesh object. See pyrit.mesh.

  • shape_function (ShapeFunction) – A shape function object. See pyrit.shapefunction.

  • regions (Regions) – A regions object. See pyrit.regions.

  • materials (Materials) – A materials object. See pyrit.materials.

  • excitations (Excitations) – An excitations object. See pyrit.excitation.

Methods

Computes the absolute field.

Check if the solution is consistent.

Attributes

b_field

Magnetic flux density.

curlcurl_matrix

The curl-curl matrix.

The current density.

The energy in the whole domain.

The energy density.

Magnetic field strength.

List of attributes that are not saved

The load vector.

mass

The mass matrix from the conductivity

mass_one

The mass matrix with mass 1.

An array with the node indices that are not on the z-axis.

Identifier for the __repr__ method.

The vector potential.

vector_potential_field_values

The field values of the vector potential.
solution_identifier: str = 'Static, axisymmetric magnetic solution'

Identifier for the __repr__ method.

consistency_check()

Check if the solution is consistent.

property energy: float

The energy in the whole domain.

property energy_density: ndarray

The energy density. Array with one value per mesh node.

energy_in_regions(*region_ids: int) → float

Compute the energy in certain regions.

Parameters

region_ids (int) – Region IDs of the regions to compute the energy in.

Returns

energy – The energy

Return type

float

:raises ValueError : When the region of one ID is not two-dimensional.:

  • ax (Axes) – A axes object.

static absolute_field(field: ndarray)

Computes the absolute field.

Parameters

field (np.ndarray) – The field. A (N,2) or a (2,N) array.

Returns

absolute_field – The absolute value of the field. A (N,) array.

Return type

np.ndarray

:raises ValueError : When the input array is not of one of ht expected shapes.:

property b_field: ndarray

Magnetic flux density. Array with two values (r- and z-component) per mesh element.

property curlcurl_matrix: coo_matrix

The curl-curl matrix.

property current_density: ndarray

The current density.

property h_field: ndarray

Magnetic field strength. Array with two values (r- and z-component) per mesh element.

ignore_for_saving = ['_nodes_not_on_axis', '_vector_potential_field_values', '_b_field', '_h_field', '_curlcurl_matrix', '_mass', '_mass_one', '_load_vector']

static load(path: Union[str, Path]) → Solution

Load a solution.

Parameters

path (Union[str, Path]) – The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information.

Returns

solution – A solution instance.

Return type

Solution

property load_vector: ndarray

The load vector. Array with one value per mesh node.

The mass matrix with mass 1.

property nodes_not_on_axis: ndarray

An array with the node indices that are not on the z-axis.

project_to_c_vector(r_vector: ndarray) → ndarray

Wrapper around VectorConverter.r_to_c_vector() with class specific defaults.

Parameters

r_vector (np.ndarray) –

Returns

c_vector

Return type

np.ndarray

save(path: Union[str, Path], ignore_attributes: Optional[List[str]] = None) → Path

Saves the solution instance.

Parameters

  • path (Union[str, Path]) –

    The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information. If the path contains a non-existing folder, this folder will be created.

  • ignore_attributes (List[str], optional) – A list of attributes that are not included in the saved file. The default value is ignore_for_saving of the object.

Returns

path – The path that was used for opening the file.

Return type

Path

classmethod solution_from_problem(description: str, problem: StaticProblem, solution: ndarray) → StaticSolution

Create a static solution from a static problem.

Parameters

  • description (str) – Description of the static solution.

  • problem (StaticProblem) – A static problem.

  • solution (np.ndarray) – The solution of the static problem.

Returns

static_solution

Return type

StaticSolution

property vector_potential: ndarray

The vector potential. These are the coefficients for the basis functions.

property vector_potential_field_values

The field values of the vector potential.
